alert.note: Alert for Ashland; Bayfield; Douglas; Sawyer; Washburn (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 5:46PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHWESTERN BAYFIELD, SOUTHEASTERN DOUGLAS, NORTHEASTERN WASHBURN, WESTERN ASHLAND AND NORTHWESTERN SAWYER COUNTIES THROUGH 615 PM CDT... At 546 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles east of Wascott, or 13 miles northwest of Hayward, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Cable and Seeley around 600 PM CDT. Round Lake around 605 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Namekagon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for northwestern Wisconsin.
